lead_paragraph: Arian Prevalla, a flight instructor, offered his account to officials looking into why the aircraft went down in East Hartford, Conn., killing his student, Fera M. Freitekh.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matt Apuzzo from Washington; Lisa W. Foderaro from Hartford; Kristin Hussey from East Hartford, Conn.; Mitch Smith from Orland Hills, Ill.; and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan. Jack Begg contributed research from New York.
byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and AL BAKER

headline.print_headline: Plane Crash Survivor Tells of Argument in Cockpit
headline.main: Survivor of Connecticut Plane Crash Tells of Argument in Cockpit

snippet: Arian Prevalla, a flight instructor, offered his account to officials looking into why the aircraft went down in East Hartford, Conn., killing his student, Fera M. Freitekh....
abstract: Flight instructor Arian Prevalla, who narrowly survived crash of twin-engine pane in East Hartford, Conn, tells authorities that he and his student Fera M Freitekh were arguing in cockpit just prior to wreck.
